Kali Mata mandir is one of the famous temple of maa kali in Begusarai.This place is known as KALI STHAN.The temple is situated in a very small area.Goats are sacrificed in this temple.There is a lot of traffic in this area.

The special feature of this temple is that it is situated very close to the road, hence all the travelers passing through this road get the pleasure of darshan of Mother Goddess and along with it, she also gets blessings of Mother Goddess.🚩🚩🚩

This temple is to beautiful. It's architect is like wow. It is a famous
Kali temple of Begusarai due to this most time here is to traffic. Here you can easily get goods for worship. Near it Many mall is here so you can visit once.

places_with_reviews.name: Begusarai Sangrahalaya

reviews.text: Antiquities from Buddhist period, Maurya period, Mughal period to Pal period are present here.  According to information, the word Anguttarap has been used for Begusarai in the ancient Buddhist texts Anguttara and Mahavagga. Begusarai district's Jaimangalagarh, Naulagarh, Virpur, Baripura, Vikrampur, Nurullahpur, Singhaul, Rajwada, Garhpura, Ejni, Ekamba, Malipur, Morattar, Meghaul  Abundant amount of historical material has been found from places like Vasudevpur, Kaith, Baraith etc.  These historical heritage are preserved in the Begusarai Museum. Establishment of Begusarai Museum Begusarai Museum was established in the year 1981.  What are the preserved pottery sculptures in the museum: The museum has displays of pottery from the Mauryan period to the Pal period.
Best Quality Treatment, and Best docter
Sambodhi retreet is very good.
Best place to know about Begusarai

Established in the year 1981, this government museum houses physical evidences that witnessed the rich cultural history of Begusarai. Stone sculptures of Lord Buddha, Lord Ganesh, Sun God and Lord Vishnu etc. can be seen here. Coins, ranging from the period of Pal rule, Mauryan Rule to the end of British Era in India are treasured in the museum. Other attractions include manuscripts, terracotta and pottery specimens. Art objects are collected from all around the town, though the centuries.
